title: Benin joins the implementation of the AU and AMCOW ’s Capacity Development Programme on Economics of Adaptation Water Security, and Climate Resilient Development in Africa | UNDP Climate Change Adaptation

quotes: December 31, 2013
At Grand-Popo on 26th of December 2013, the government of Benin has launched the implementation of the AU and AMCOW Capacity Development Programme

time_markers.text: from the 25th to the 29th of November 2013
quotes: after participating in the 1st Training of Trainers (ToT) workshop on the programme held in Addis Ababa from the 25th to the 29th of November 2013
the programme will be expanded to the following 17 countries in 2014

roles.title: Minister in charge of the Coordination of policies and the implementation of the Millennium Development Goals (MDG) and Sustainable Development Goals (SDG)

roles.title: Minister of Health
quotes: Prof. Dorothee Kindé – Gazard Minister of Health
At Grand-Popo on 26th of December 2013, the government of Benin has launched the implementation of the AU and AMCOW Capacity Development Programme
Benin joins the implementation of the AU and AMCOW ’s Capacity Development Programme
the government of Benin has launched the implementation of the AU and AMCOW Capacity Development Programme
In Benin the focus of the initiative will be the ‘‘Evaluation, modeling and economic forecasting of climate impacts to optimize adaptation strategies and resilient development’

Prof. Fulbert Gero Amoussouga has emphasized on the need for Experts of various sectors to discuss approaches and methodologies to mainstream climate change adaptation into development planning processes at all levels in Benin
Prof. Dorothee Kindé – Gazard said that many diseases in Benin become critical due to the negative impacts of climate change
after participating in the 1st Training of Trainers (ToT) workshop on the programme held in Addis Ababa from the 25th to the 29th of November 2013
the program is implemented initially in eight countries: Burkina Faso, Burundi, Cameroon, Ghana, Mozambique, Rwanda, Tunisia and Zimbabwe
